result.execSummary:
All charges against Lonny Allen Mayer in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lonny Allen Mayer is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lonny Allen Mayer

records.addlTxt: from client, filed.

Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer appeared by video, in custody.  Tom Reed appeared on behalf of the public defenders office and Gary Rosenthal as a friend of the court..  Attorney Nicolas J Heitman in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Court acknowledges prompt disposition request which expires 10/10/2022.  Public defenders office requests additional time to find appointment of counsel and requests status of counsel date.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed without prejudice.
Received and Filed. Request for Prompt Disposition Received 8-22-22

Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen appeared by video for Lonny Allen Mayer.  Attorney Nicolas J Heitman appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  For reasons stated on the record, defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Court discussed defendants motion to proceed pro se.  Court denies request and continues Judge Rosa's and Judge Havas' earlier findings.  Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Additionally, Court finds GOOD CAUSE to toll time limits for preliminary hearing.

Court addressed defendant's motion to lift prison restrictions.  Court will allow defendant to speak with the public defenders office and attorney Jeff Jensen, but denies any further lifting of restrictions.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Per Remittitur dated August 17, 2022, Appeal Nos 2022AP923-CRLV (2020CM1421), 2022AP928-CRLV (2020CF617), 2022AP929-CRLV (2020CF4068), 2022AP930-CRLV (2021CF5042), 2022AP931-CRLV (2022CF823), 
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on July 7, 2022, that:
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for to leave to appeal in case No. 2022AP931-CRLV is voluntarily dismissed.
IT IS ORDERED that the petitions for leave to appeal in case Nos. 2022AP923-CRLV, 2022AP928-CRLV, 2022AP929-CRLV, and 22AP930-CRLV are dismissed for lack of jurisdiction without costs to any party.

Per Order dated June 23, 2022, Appeal Nos 2022AP923-CRLV (2020CM1421), 2022AP928-CRLV (2020CF617), 2022AP929-CRLV (2020CF4068), 2022AP930-CRLV (2021CF5042), 2022AP931-CRLV (2022CF823),
IT IS ORDERED that case Nos. 22AP923-CRLV, 22AP928-CRLV, 22AP929-CRLV, 22AP930-CRLV, and 22AP931-CRLV are consolidated for disposition purposes.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for the State to file a consolidated response in these matters is extended to July 6, 2022.

Per Order dated June 30, 2022, Appeal Nos 2022AP923-CRLV (2020CM1421), 2022AP928-CRLV (2020CF617), 2022AP929-CRLV (2020CF4068), 2022AP930-CRLV (2021CF5042), 2022AP931-CRLV (2022CF823),
IT IS ORDERED that the motion for reconsideration, so construed, is denied.

Per Order dated July 7, 2022, Appeal Nos 2022AP923-CRLV (2020CM1421), 2022AP928-CRLV (2020CF617), 2022AP929-CRLV (2020CF4068), 2022AP930-CRLV (2021CF5042), 2022AP931-CRLV (2022CF823),
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for to leave to appeal in case No. 2022AP931-CRLV is voluntarily dismissed.
IT IS ORDERED that the petitions for leave to appeal in case Nos. 2022AP923-CRLV, 2022AP928-CRLV, 2022AP929-CRLV, and 22AP930-CRLV are dismissed for lack of jurisdiction without costs to any party.
to Withdraw as Counsel, received and filed

Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer in court with attorney Thomas Holland Reed appearing as a friend of the Court.  Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for order to show cause hearing. Court hears arguments. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court adopts findings of Judge Havas on defendant's other cases and finds the defendant is not able to self represent. Defendant motions to reinstate privileges. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defendant's motion. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Per Order dated June 30, 2022, Appeal No 2022AP923-CRLV (2020CM1421), 2022AP928-CRLV (2020CF617), 2022AP929-CRLV (2020CF4068), 2022AP930-CRLV (2021CF5042), 2022AP931-CRLV (2022CF823), 
IT IS ORDERED that the motion for reconsideration, so construed, is denied.

Per Order dated June 23, 2022, Appeal Nos 2022AP923-CRLV (2020CM1421), 2022AP928-CRLV ( 2020CF617), 2022AP929-CRLV ( 2020CF4068), 2022AP930-CRLV (2021CF5042), and 2022AP931-CRLV ( 2022CF823), 
IT IS ORDERED that case Nos. 22AP923-CRLV, 22AP928-CRLV, 22AP929-CRLV, 22AP930-CRLV, and 22AP931-CRLV are consolidated for disposition purposes. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for the State to file a consolidated response in these matters is extended to July 6, 2022.

Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer not in court, defendant in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court orders a respresentative from the SPD appear on the next date if an attorney is not appointed. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Petition and Memorandum Court of Appeals May 20th 2022
Filed and Received

Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer in Court with Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal as a friend of the Court.  Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
**Attorney Gary Rosenthal has not officially been appointed as Stand-By Counsel on Case 20CM1421.**

Case in Court for Decision hearing. Defendant appeared via Zoom Video Conference. State and Attorney Rosenthal appeared in Room 504 of the Courthouse. 
Defendant currently has FOUR CASES in Branch 10: 20CM1421, 20CF4068, 20CF617, and 22CF823. 
Defendant previously requested to appear PRO SE. 
Defendant previously filed a REQUEST FOR SUBSTITUTION. 
Extensive statements made by the parties. 
Court placed findings of fact and legal analysis on the record. 
Court found Defendant FORFEITED his right to appear PRO SE. 
Regarding CASE 22CF823: Court consented to substitution against Judge Havas. Pursuant to current Court rules, Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned CASE 22CF823 to JUDGE KIEFER, BRANCH 29.  
Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. 
Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
State submitted document/letter
State's Motion to Recind Defendant's Communication, filed.
State's Motion To Recind Defendant's Communication, filed.
filed.
Court reviewed defense's motion filed and will reschedule hearing/decision date.  Parties and Green Bay CI notified of new date by email.  Next court date is 5/20/2022 at 8:30 am for Decision.

Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer in court, in custody.  Ryan Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant would like to proceed Pro Se. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in the trial court.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Motion To Adjourn, filed.
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge.  (Lonny A. Mayer - #167104, Green Bay Correctional Institution, PO Box 19033, Green Bay WI 54301-9033).

Court ordered no contact with M.K.L
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs, as friend of the court. Defendant advised court he wants to proceed without counsel.  Defendant examined as to request.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to counsel and is competent to proceed without counsel. Defendant Lonny Allen Mayer in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lonny Allen Mayer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. As to count 1  Motion to dismiss by defendant DENIED by the Court. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant as to count 4. Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
